pullRequest.title: Protobuf Layout RPCs
pullRequest.bodyText:
Overview
Description: Layout RPCs using Protobuf
Why should this be merged: Provides an implementation of Layout RPCs using Protobuf. Done as part of an effort to support rolling upgrades.
Related issue(s) (if applicable): #
Checklist (Definition of Done):

 There are no TODOs left in the code
 Coding conventions (e.g. for logging, unit tests) have been followed
 Change is covered by automated tests
 Public API has Javadoc

nodes.bodyText: Reformat imports.
Why can't you remove this in this patch? It's not needed. I think we should eagerly remove dead code paths because its hard to track them and try to delete them later.
Throw an UnsupportedOperationException instead.
Throw an UnsupportedOperationException instead.
Dead code, delete method.
I would pass the RequestMsg and extract the header just before it is needed. Passing header around seems a little strange.
The old implementation also logs a message. Can you put that back, but as a debug log?

You can remove the TODO this scenario can naturally happen. Imagine you run Paxos Layout at epoch 2. Its possible that out of the 3 nodes, only 2 nodes accepted epoch two layout. So, when a client requests a layout from the third node (i.e., the one that didn't participate in the paxos round, then it should just return the older layout. If you return a wrong epoch exception its fine, but superfluous because the clients need to check that they never regress the epoch the layout that they are tracking.
Can you drop the "REQUEST" suffix naming convention, it seems redundant. Maybe use RequestPayloadMsg.PayloadCase.BOOTSTRAP_LAYOUT
You don't need to log the request id since its per-channel and only used to timeout/complete requests.

Can you reverse the logic and get rid of the if-else here?
You can check if(getCurrentLayout() != null) you can send the error message and return right away. Otherwise continue to save the new bootstrap layout.
Un-nest this, move the validation to the top (after the layout.getClusterId() == null check)
Log the newly bootstrapped layout as info
Instead of calling this from each handler, you can just move it to processRequest. Note that it needs to be called on all messages except for LAYOUT_NOBOOTSTRAP

Why is this responseHeader different than the one in line 277
The response header should always copy its metadata from the requestHeader.
Not used?

Wouldn't it be cleaner to pass the requestHeader to these methods and have these methods construct and return the final message. Instead of doing this construction all over the place it can be in one place, here.
Remove. All of this uses protobuf messages now. Also, don't forget to remove Layout requests/responses from CorfuMsgType.
Remove all usages of CorfuMsgType with these changes those paths become inactive. Its better to remove them than assume that they are not functional.
Cleaner to use a boolean in the protobuf message. See comment above.
Can we add the Javadocs for the methods in this class?
LayoutPrepareResponse no longer needs to implement ICorfuPayoad. It can be removed, along with the related serialization methods.

nodes.bodyText:
We need the default header for the next set of handleMessage() calls of MANAGEMENT_BOOTSTRAP_REQUEST and BOOTSTRAP_SEQUENCER.
Therefore, Can we move this to CorfuProtocolMessage?
We can add a new method to get default header and call CorfuProtocolMessage.getRequestMsg() with that header and the new payloadMsg.
public static HeaderMsg getDefaultHeaderMsg(boolean ignoreClusterId, boolean ignoreEpoch) {
    return getHeaderMsg(0, CorfuMessage.PriorityLevel.NORMAL, 0,
        DEFAULT_UUID, DEFAULT_UUID, ignoreClusterId, ignoreEpoch);
}

Note: Unfortunately, we cannot use HeaderMsg.getDefaultInstance() provided by Protobuf as it sets the values to empty instead of the default intended values. Its output is -
headerMsg.getRequestId() - 0
headerMsg.getClientId() - 
headerMsg.getClusterId() - 
headerMsg.getEpoch() - 0
headerMsg.getIgnoreEpoch() - false
headerMsg.getIgnoreClusterId() - false
headerMsg.getPriority() - PRIORITY_LEVEL_INVALID
headerMsg.getVersion() -

nodes.bodyText: Should this be getBasicHeader(false, true)?
This can be removed as this is the default behaviour in AbstractServer.
Since getLayout() can return null, we should also perform a check for null here.
Should we perform a check for null before this?
getHeaderMsg(requestHeader, false, true) since successful?
Can we also verify that the setCurrentLayout method was called on the mockServerContext?
Consider also verifying that setCurrentLayout was not called in this case?
Same here.
Can you also verify the correct epoch argument is what you expect?
Can we also add a test that the request is ignored and that an error is sent if the server isn't bootstrapped yet? Consider doing so for the other RPCs too, where applicable.
Can you also verify that the correct epoch is what you expect?
Are these argument captors necessary? I think calling verify with the expected object should suffice here. In most cases, if you know the result ahead of time, you don't need an argument captor.
Same here.

I know this predates your patch, but honestly this doesn't make sense at all: having a multi-threaded executor to server the request handlers and marking all the handlers as synchronized is just lol.
Can you just change this.executor  to be single threaded and drop all the synchronized ?
